flow.descriptionCdata:
71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.16ad9892-daf7-44b5-89bc-5b0335c527f4.description=
Gets the status, and load of all processors in the system, and the quantity or processors.

Input Parameters\:
host - Computer to query.
username - Username to use for WMI impersonation on the host for this operation (can be left blank).
password - Password of the user.

Responses\:
failure - Failed to get processor info.
offline processors - 1 or more processor does not have a status of 'ok'.
success - All processors are online.

Extra Results\:
ic_online - The status of the computer's processors (comma separated).
ic_load - The load of the computer's processors (comma separated).
ic_numProcs	- The number of processors in the computer.
ic_blockedThreads - The number of threads blocking on the machine.
71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.3d511ef6-fd7c-4440-a280-c0d0dd875b4c.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wqlQuery - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.44cb518b-20a9-44da-a2cf-2cfbd48e8822.callout=This flow performs a Windows system health check. The information retrieved includes\: free memory, system uptime, processes and files lists. 71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.4ef2aec6-84a1-48aa-a204-dd51de3728f0.description=
Runs a Ping command either locally or remotely depending on the specified protocol. Credentials and other inputs (remoteOS, hostname, username, password, keyFile etc) are required if the command must be run from a remote host. The Telnet protocol also requires inputs for usernamePrompt and passwordPrompt. 

Inputs\:
    hostname - Hostname or IP address of the host computer where the Ping command will be executed.
    username - A username to authenticate to the host computer. 
    password - The password for the user account.
    targetHost - Hostname or IP address of the target host computer.
    protocol  - The protocol used to run the command.
Valid values\: local, ssh, Telnet
    packetSize - The size of the ping packet.
    packetCount - The number of ping packets to send.
    remoteOS - The operating system of the host computer (WINDOWS, LINUX, SOLARIS only are supported), if Ping is running on a remote host.
    usernamePrompt - The username prompt seen while using Telnet protocol. This input is required when Telnet protocol is used. For example, login\:.
    passwordPrompt - The password prompt seen while using Telnet protocol. This input is required when Telnet protocol is used. For example, password\:.
    keyFile - The path to the private key file for remote host. The path should be absolute.
    timeout - The timeout in miliseconds for the Ping operation. Default is 90000.

Responses\:
    success - The command executed successfully.
    failure - The command could not be executed or had a problem during execution.

Returns\:
    packetsSent - The number of packets sent.
    packetsReceived - The number of packets received.
    percentagePacketsLost - The percentage of packets lost.
    transmissionTimeMin - Minimum time taken for transmitting the packet.
    transmissionTimeMax - Maximum time taken for transmitting the packet.
    transmissionTimeAvg - Average time taken for transmitting the packet.
    returnResult - Raw output of the command.
    returnCode - Return code of the executed command.
    error - The STDERR of the command.

71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.description=
 This flow checks the overall health of a Windows server. It checks for many common problems, such as testing if the server is running, how much free memory the server has, and what percentage of its CPU is currently being utilized. 

Inputs\:
    host - The hostname or IP address of the Windows system to check the health of.
    username - The user to connect to the host. Not required for localhost.
    username - The password to connect to the host. Not required for localhost.

Responses\:
    success - Server health check completed.
    failure - An error occurred when pinging the server, the health check could not be performed.

Results\:
    filesystem - The list of labels by which the storage devices are known
    uptime - The number of minutes the system has been up
    iostat - Information about Plug and Play devices that have an erroneous status 
    os - The name of the operating system
    processList - The list of running processes
    freeMemory - Number, in kilobytes, of physical memory currently unused and available
    numProcs - The number of processors
    nicErrors - The list of network adapters that have errors
    osType - The operating system type ( windows )
    exception - The error message in case of failure.
71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.ed6d3654-d22c-4b6e-9322-dad2a3fac672.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.f384d8d9-5c6e-41f2-b148-bc5a45a3a9e8.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
71702a89-5c78-42ac-9701-bab4d79b21e6.fb2edd88-c202-4b13-89da-075e3e5777cb.description=
Runs a WMI query and formats the results.

Inputs\:
wqlQuery - the query to run.
namespace - the wmi namespace to run the query in.
host - the host to run the query against.
user - a user to authenticate with host as.
password - the password for user.
format - How to format the query's results (text or csv).

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded.
failure - an error occurred.
flow.name: Windows Health Check

scriptlet.name: Step Get FileSystem Information in Flow Windows Health Check (fb2edd88-c202-4b13-89da-075e3e5777cb)

staticBinding.value: Select Name, FreeSpace, Size from Win32_LogicalDisk

scriptlet.name: Step Get Running Process List in Flow Windows Health Check (d2dc22ea-8463-4513-87e4-4814f2eac990)
Step Get System Uptime in Flow Windows Health Check (ccfe524b-05fa-443a-bea9-4a469d9524a8)
Step Check for Malfunctioning Devices in Flow Windows Health Check (66844d22-073e-4c44-985b-f4dddb8f0f68)

staticBinding.value: Select * from Win32_PnPEntity where Status = 'Error' OR Status = 'Pred Fail' OR Status = 'Stressed ' OR Status = 'NonRecover'

scriptlet.name: Step Get Network Interface Errors in Flow Windows Health Check (97e261be-1a8f-434b-898a-e4991bb45686)

staticBinding.value: Select Name, ConfigManagerErrorCode from Win32_NetworkAdapter where ConfigManagerErrorCode > 0
no errors in the network interfaces

scriptlet.name: Step Get Processor Count/Status in Flow Windows Health Check (16ad9892-daf7-44b5-89bc-5b0335c527f4)
Step Get Host Name in Flow Windows Health Check (3d511ef6-fd7c-4440-a280-c0d0dd875b4c)
Step Free Physical Memory in Flow Windows Health Check (c4f5ee83-f734-4e33-84ed-fa9dabc8812f)
